turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Variax.
turn.1: What are the different Variax models?
turn.2: Line 6 marketed four models of Variax acoustic modeling guitars: the 300 Nylon String and 300 Steel String, which allow varying virtualbody size and mic placement—and the more expensive steel stringed, cedar (later spruce)-topped 700, which pitch-shifts individual strings to provide alternate tunings.
turn.3: What other differences are there between the models?
turn.4: The 700 emulates over a dozen rare and desirable acoustic instruments, including an acoustic Indian sitar, rather than the Coral electric sitar modeled in the electric Variaxes.
turn.6: Line 6 produced a rare and final model dubbed the 900, of which only 50 were produced and distributed by Line 6.
turn.8: The 900s were made in Japan rather than Korea as the 700s were.
turn.9: Was there anything else unique about the 900?
turn.10: The 900s had a solid body with a semi hollow acoustic style facade sound hole, maple neck, and rosewood fingerboard was adorned with diamond shaped mother of pearl inlay instead of the cross design the 700s had, it also had an abalone inlay "V" at the 12th fret.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: The most publicly recognized Variax Acoustic 900 was used by recording artist James Taylor, while singing the American National Anthem at the opening ceremony of the NBA Finals of 2008, as well as an event hosted at Borders Bookstore.
